page.title: 01GLESPIN VILLAGE AND ENVIRONS
page.content: The block includes the small village of Glespin, surrounding farms and some open moorland. Glespin used to be a mining village but since the closure of the pit few men are now involved in mining. There is much unemployment and the only local employer is a transport depot. The village has a bus service in both easterly and westerly directions, but the railway which used to run past the village is disused. The buses are not frequent and not at the most suitable times, making it difficult for people to travel to what work is available. Glespin has no shops and few amenities, but the village school still survives. The surrounding farms rear mainly sheep as these are most suitable for the hilly moorland of the area.
